title: Stat death
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

*Stat death no longer occurs. For its replacement, see [stat zero](/Stat_zero "Stat zero").*

**Stat death** occurs 90 turns after one of a character's primary [attributes](/Attributes "Attributes") ([Strength](/Strength "Strength"), [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence"), or [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity")) lowered to 0 or below. The character will die unless the stat can be restored in time. After 50 turns have passed, the character can be [paralyzed](/Paralysis "Paralysis") which is also very dangerous.

The following can all drain your attributes:

- By 1 at a time, and affected (and thus blocked) by [sustain abilities](/Sustain_abilities "Sustain abilities"):

  - The [Deterioration](/Bad_mutations#Deterioration "Bad mutations") mutation. Rank 1 can generally be kept in check by your natural regeneration; ranks 2 and 3 of this mutation are eventually lethal, however.
  - [Sickness](/Sickness "Sickness")
  - The special attacks of certain monsters ([brain worms](/Brain_worm "Brain worm"), [quasits](/Quasit "Quasit"), [shadows](/Shadow "Shadow"), etc.). Although all three stats can be drained, INT is by far the one most commonly affected. This is because it is drained by a smite-targeted spell, where the others are drained only through melee attacks.
  - Decomposition (not to be confused with [rotting](/Rotting "Rotting")) from attempted [mutation](/Mutation "Mutation") of an undead character.

- By more than 1 at a time, but damage can be halved by [sustain abilities](/Sustain_abilities "Sustain abilities"):

  - Evoking certain items, such as a [crystal ball of energy](/Crystal_ball_of_energy "Crystal ball of energy") or the [staff of Wucad Mu](/Staff_of_Wucad_Mu "Staff of Wucad Mu").
  - Spell [miscast effects](/Miscast_effect "Miscast effect"), as caused by actual miscasts, [Hell](/Hell "Hell") effects, and [Zot traps](/Zot_trap "Zot trap").
  - Certain spells, such as [Summon Horrible Things](/Summon_Horrible_Things "Summon Horrible Things") or [Alistair's Intoxication](/Alistair%27s_Intoxication "Alistair's Intoxication"), have a chance of draining INT when cast.

- By varying amounts, and not affected at all by sustain abilities:
  - Equipment with negative stat modifiers (but you can remove the equipment to restore the stat).

Stats can be more permanently lowered by the following means:

- [Mutations](/Mutations "Mutations") which affect attributes (directly, or through stiff/loose muscles, some scale mutations, etc.).
- The [Focus card](/Focus_card "Focus card").
- [Jiyva](/Jiyva "Jiyva")'s stat shuffling.
- The [Shuffle card](/Shuffle_card "Shuffle card").

The last two will never lower a base stat to zero, but when combined with one of the above effects could still cause stat death.

## Precautions

Any character with a particularly low attribute should be aware of the dangers involved. Any attribute below 8 could conceivably be reduced to 0 by a single unfortunate effect, some of which are common, some less so.

- Cursed equipment can reduce an attribute by up to 6 for as long as it's equipped, so be cautious about wearing unidentified items if you're at risk. This is especially dangerous in regards to INT, as a character with 0 INT cannot read [scrolls](/Scroll "Scroll") (and thus cannot read a [scroll of remove curse](/Scroll_of_remove_curse "Scroll of remove curse") in order to remove the offending item). Low-INT characters may wish to keep a [potion of brilliance](/Potion_of_brilliance "Potion of brilliance") on hand to give them a window of time in which they can read scrolls.
- Miscast effects, Hell effects, [Zot traps](/Zot_trap "Zot trap"), and [mummy](/Mummy "Mummy") [death curses](/Death_curse "Death curse") can temporarily reduce an attribute by up to 7. You may wish to bring all of your attributes up to a minumum of 8 to guarantee that you can survive a single worst-case scenario shot from either one.

## History

Stat death was removed in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"). In its place, characters now suffer some penalties when at [stat zero](/Stat_zero "Stat zero").

Prior to [0.7](/0.7 "0.7"), stat death occurred immediately upon a stat hitting 0.
html:
Stat death

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.

Stat death no longer occurs. For its replacement, see stat zero.

Stat death occurs 90 turns after one of a character's primary attributes (Strength, Intelligence, or Dexterity) lowered to 0 or below. The character will die unless the stat can be restored in time. After 50 turns have passed, the character can be paralyzed which is also very dangerous.

The following can all drain your attributes:

  • By 1 at a time, and affected (and thus blocked) by sustain abilities:
    • The Deterioration mutation. Rank 1 can generally be kept in check by your natural regeneration; ranks 2 and 3 of this mutation are eventually lethal, however.
    • Sickness
    • The special attacks of certain monsters (brain worms, quasits, shadows, etc.). Although all three stats can be drained, INT is by far the one most commonly affected. This is because it is drained by a smite-targeted spell, where the others are drained only through melee attacks.
    • Decomposition (not to be confused with rotting) from attempted mutation of an undead character.
  • By more than 1 at a time, but damage can be halved by sustain abilities:
    • Evoking certain items, such as a crystal ball of energy or the staff of Wucad Mu.
    • Spell miscast effects, as caused by actual miscasts, Hell effects, and Zot traps.
    • Certain spells, such as Summon Horrible Things or Alistair's Intoxication, have a chance of draining INT when cast.
  • By varying amounts, and not affected at all by sustain abilities:
    • Equipment with negative stat modifiers (but you can remove the equipment to restore the stat).

Stats can be more permanently lowered by the following means:

  • Mutations which affect attributes (directly, or through stiff/loose muscles, some scale mutations, etc.).
  • The Focus card.
  • Jiyva's stat shuffling.
  • The Shuffle card.

The last two will never lower a base stat to zero, but when combined with one of the above effects could still cause stat death.

Precautions

Any character with a particularly low attribute should be aware of the dangers involved. Any attribute below 8 could conceivably be reduced to 0 by a single unfortunate effect, some of which are common, some less so.

  • Cursed equipment can reduce an attribute by up to 6 for as long as it's equipped, so be cautious about wearing unidentified items if you're at risk. This is especially dangerous in regards to INT, as a character with 0 INT cannot read scrolls (and thus cannot read a scroll of remove curse in order to remove the offending item). Low-INT characters may wish to keep a potion of brilliance on hand to give them a window of time in which they can read scrolls.
  • Miscast effects, Hell effects, Zot traps, and mummy death curses can temporarily reduce an attribute by up to 7. You may wish to bring all of your attributes up to a minumum of 8 to guarantee that you can survive a single worst-case scenario shot from either one.

History

Stat death was removed in 0.13. In its place, characters now suffer some penalties when at stat zero.

Prior to 0.7, stat death occurred immediately upon a stat hitting 0.

rawPage:
{{obsolete}}

''Stat death no longer occurs. For its replacement, see [[stat zero]].''

'''Stat death''' occurs 90 turns after one of a character's primary [[attributes]] ([[Strength]], [[Intelligence]], or [[Dexterity]]) lowered to 0 or below. The character will die unless the stat can be restored in time. After 50 turns have passed, the character can be [[paralysis|paralyzed]] which is also very dangerous.

The following can all drain your attributes:
*By 1 at a time, and affected (and thus blocked) by [[sustain abilities]]:
**The [[bad mutations#Deterioration|Deterioration]] mutation. Rank 1 can generally be kept in check by your natural regeneration; ranks 2 and 3 of this mutation are eventually lethal, however.
**[[Sickness]]
**The special attacks of certain monsters ([[brain worm]]s, [[quasit]]s, [[shadow]]s, etc.).  Although all three stats can be drained, INT is by far the one most commonly affected.  This is because it is drained by a smite-targeted spell, where the others are drained only through melee attacks.
**Decomposition (not to be confused with [[rotting]]) from attempted [[mutation]] of an undead character.
*By more than 1 at a time, but damage can be halved by [[sustain abilities]]:
**Evoking certain items, such as a [[crystal ball of energy]] or the [[staff of Wucad Mu]].
**Spell [[miscast effect]]s, as caused by actual miscasts, [[Hell]] effects, and [[Zot trap]]s.
**Certain spells, such as [[Summon Horrible Things]] or [[Alistair's Intoxication]], have a chance of draining INT when cast.
*By varying amounts, and not affected at all by sustain abilities:
**Equipment with negative stat modifiers (but you can remove the equipment to restore the stat).

Stats can be more permanently lowered by the following means:
*[[Mutations]] which affect attributes (directly, or through stiff/loose muscles, some scale mutations, etc.).
*The [[Focus card]].
*[[Jiyva]]'s stat shuffling.
*The [[Shuffle card]].

The last two will never lower a base stat to zero, but when combined with one of the above effects could still cause stat death.

==Precautions==
Any character with a particularly low attribute should be aware of the dangers involved. Any attribute below 8 could conceivably be reduced to 0 by a single unfortunate effect, some of which are common, some less so.
*Cursed equipment can reduce an attribute by up to 6 for as long as it's equipped, so be cautious about wearing unidentified items if you're at risk. This is especially dangerous in regards to INT, as a character with 0 INT cannot read [[scroll]]s (and thus cannot read a [[scroll of remove curse]] in order to remove the offending item). Low-INT characters may wish to keep a [[potion of brilliance]] on hand to give them a window of time in which they can read scrolls.
*Miscast effects, Hell effects, [[Zot trap]]s, and [[mummy]] [[death curse]]s can temporarily reduce an attribute by up to 7. You may wish to bring all of your attributes up to a minumum of 8 to guarantee that you can survive a single worst-case scenario shot from either one.

==History==
Stat death was removed in [[0.13]]. In its place, characters now suffer some penalties when at [[stat zero]].

Prior to [[0.7]], stat death occurred immediately upon a stat hitting 0.
